content.title: Abdul Kalam Technology Innovation National Fellowship
content.beneficiary: Indian Nationals and Overseas Citizens of India working in public funded institutions
content.details: The Abdul Kalam Technology Innovation National Fellowship was launched in 2017 to recognize, encourage, support, and promote translational research in engineering by Indian Nationals working in public funded institutions. The scheme aims to transfer fundamental research output into viable technological products/devices/components/processes. It is administered by the Science and Engineering Research Board (SERB) and implemented by the Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE).
benefits: Fellowship amount of ₹25,000/- per month in addition to regular income.
Research grant of ₹15.00 lakh per annum.
Overhead of ₹1.00 lakh per annum to the host institute.
eligibility: Applicable to Indian nationals working in India in various capacities of engineering profession in publicly funded institutions.
Applicable to Overseas Citizens of India working in permanent positions in publicly funded Institutions in India.
Applicant should possess adequate professional qualifications and hold at least a bachelor’s degree with a proven outstanding track record in innovation or technology development.
Applicant should have a minimum of five (5) years of service left in the parent organization as of the date of the award.
Applicant should not be holding any other fellowship.
content.application_process: Nominations will be accepted throughout the year, sent by Heads of Institutions/organizations, Presidents/fellows of National Science/Engineering Academies, SS Bhatnagar Awardees, and JC Bose awardees. Self-nominations shall not be accepted.
documents_required: Proof that the candidate is working
Bank Details (Bank Account Number, Name of the Bank, Bank Branch, and IFSC Code)

faqs.question: What is the objective of the Scheme?
faqs.answer: The principal objective of the Fellowship is to achieve excellence in engineering, innovation and technology development.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The scheme was launched in the year 2017.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for applying/availing the Fellowship?
faqs.answer: The scheme is applicable to Indian nationals as well as Overseas Citizens of India (OCI) working in permanent positions in engineering profession in public funded institutions in India.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the Fellowship?
faqs.answer: The duration of the fellowship will be initially three years, extendable by up to two more years depending on the performance.
